definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to deal in/to buy and sell/to trade in/to retail/to peddle

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He bought the ticket at a high price from a (ticket) scalper.
sentences.chinese: 他從一個票販子手裏高價買了張黃牛票。

sentences.english: We are able to get ticket to the “AndyLau” concert from a scalper outside the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 我們在體育場外從票販子手裏買了華仔演唱會的票。

sentences.english: We were plagued by ticket sharks at the entrance to the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我們在劇院門口被票販子纏住了。

sentences.english: We are able to get ticket to the "AndyLau" concert from a scalper outside the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 在體育場外從票販子手裏買了華仔演唱會的票。

sentences.english: Vote on the traffickers , the masses have a lot of wisdom to offer advice and suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 就票販子的情況，羣衆也有無窮的智慧來獻計獻策。

sentences.english: A scalper sold us tickets for seats right at near the courtside.
sentences.chinese: 一個票販子賣給我們的票正好靠近球場的邊緣。
